intro: Tium malheurense, commonly known as the Malheur tium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators. Tium malheurense is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
